profiles:
Summary •	Experienced in a wide range of industries, including: Consumer/Custom Electronics, Medical, Oil/Gas Industry, Telecommunications, and Chip Fabrication. 
•	Proficient in full life cycle of firmware development from requirements to initial board bring up and integration through development and testing/verification of the application to release and maintenance. Specialties:•	Excellent understanding of development and testing process from contributing to product development in a variety of roles: Software Manager, Project Manager, Sr. Software Engineer, Product Engineer, Sr. Software Test Engineer, Scrum Master, and Configuration Manager. Experience Staff Program Manager Seagate Technology October 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) Longmont, CO Working with a variety of firmware teams to bring advanced disk drive and hybrid drive products to market using Agile practices. Owner Cay Sea Media October 2011  – Present (3 years 11 months) boulder, co Media company involved in the production and distributions of comic books, e-books, and children's books. Scrum Master (Agile Software Project Manager) (contractor) Intel Corporation June 2012  –  October 2013  (1 year 5 months) Longmont •	Scrum Master for over 20 developers and validation engineers (local and remote) in two functional teams developing the latest solid state hard drives for Intel.  
•	Worked closely with Program Managers on resource allocation, prioritization, and scheduling over 5 programs worked in parallel.  
•	Developed multi-Sprint release plans to track expected burn down of work to each milestone within the program. 
•	Worked with Functional Managers, Scrum Technical Leads, and Team Technical Leads to map out team short term and long term objectives. 
•	Developed automated reports and queries into the Jira system using the REST interface and Groovy and Python scripts. Sr. Firmware Engineer / Scrum Master Tendril November 2011  –  May 2012  (7 months) Working on the firmware side of Tendril's energy solution.  
•	Developed and integrated the new Smart Outlet into existing devices framework. 
•	Developed calibration and customized calibration scripting for the Smart Outlet 
•	Worked of various defects and sustaining issues as they arose. 
•	Represented firmware engineer during sustaining rotation. 
•	Provided leadership and guidance in scrum framework as a scrum master 
•	Worked closely with Product Owners and Product Management on firmware issues. 
•	Helped lead and focus development planning and estimation meetings. Sr. System Integration Engineer Tendril June 2009  –  November 2011  (2 years 6 months) •	Developed Test Plans, Test Cases, and executed test on a Zigbee Smart Energy devices. 
•	Worked closely with Firmware and Software Engineering to integrate new features into system. 
•	Developed automated tests using Selenium, Fitness, Slim, Groovy, and Java. 
•	Designed User Interface for PDA portion of a Zigbee Load Control Device and worked with third party developers defining the desired behaviors of that device. 
•	Worked with Partner Management in the testing, integration, and debugging of a Smart Energy module developed by General Electric. 
•	Worked with Product Management and Firmware Engineering in the definition of LED, Duty Cycle, and Minimum Off Time behavior on devices. Principal Software Test Engineer (Contract) Medtronic August 2008  –  June 2009  (11 months) •	Lead Software Test Engineer for RF Testing Section. 
•	Developed Test Cases and Test Designs Documents for 802.15.4 based insulin delivery system. 
•	Developed web interface to MySQL database for tracking development and status of test in Linux.  
•	Wrote test scripts for automated testing of system. 
•	Used DOORS Requirement Management and Traceability Tool, TestTrack Bug Tracking system, Surround revision control, and MS Project. 
•	Contributed to development of Test Plan and System Validation Plan. Sr. Software Test Engineer (Contract) InnerWireless October 2007  –  April 2008  (7 months) Performed installation, upgrade and preliminary testing for 802.15.4 wireless asset location system. 
Developed system initialization/configuration tools for Distributed Antenna System Integrity Monitoring(DASIM) software.  
Wrote Test Plan and System Validation Plan for DASIM.  
Executed tests for system and worked with software engineers to eliminate failure conditions and verify system functionality. Lead Firmware Engineer (Contract) AMX April 2005  –  October 2007  (2 years 7 months) Developed Zigbee components and Zigbee to device interfaces for NetLinx® ZigBee Gateway, NetLinx® ZigBee Repeater, Mio Modero R-4 Zigbee remote touch panel products. Development included use of Motorola HC08 and Ember 250 processors communicating to connected devices using SPI bus and communicating over the air using Zigbee in a mesh network.  
Developed method of over the air upgrade across multiple Zigbee nodes. 
Performed Zigbee interference testing for 802.11B/G and Class 2 Bluetooth. 
Characterized range, throughput, and multi-node transmission delays for Zigbee products. 
Developed Motion JPEG (MJPEG) configuration and video serving routines for a product running embedded Linux on an OMAP 2430 processor.  
Developed server side embedded web server for the NetLinx® ZigBee Gateway, MET-ECOM-D, MAX-CSE, and MAX-CSD10 products. Project Manager / Sr. Software Engineer Atrana Solutions April 2004  –  December 2004  (9 months) Developed software applications for Verifone and Hypercom credit/debit/ID card terminals, which are based on the Motorola 68k and Zilog Z80 processors respectively.  
Wrote Functional and Text LCD User Interface (UI) Specifications. 
Worked with marketing, client, and external contractors on project involving modification for financial terminal device. 
Worked with software vendors involving licensing and bug tracking. Senior Software Engineer (contractor) D.E. Software Consulting November 2003  –  April 2004  (6 months) Developed remote backup software using .ZIP compression, 3DES and AES file encryption and transferred backup over SSL connection. 
Client side development using C# .NET, with server side using Apache on a Linux platform with PHP, and HTML. Software Engineer (Independent Contractor) Wavetrix July 2003  –  October 2003  (4 months) Developed software for WinCE PDA for PC based traffic monitoring system, using MS Embedded C++ 
Developed software for Linux-based home network appliance, using PHP, Perl, the LWP module for Perl. Configuration Manager / Acting Software Engineering Manager Uniden America Corp September 2001  –  June 2003  (1 year 10 months) Development of a PowerPC 860SAR based VoATM gateway whose' development began at Broadband Gateway and began development on new data home networking products.  
Developed features including: user-defined static routes, Syslog, email logging, routing information protocol (RIP), system configuration, and various voice features. 
Project Management role specific to software group. Involved project scheduling, tasking of software group, research of new products and competitor's products, writing of specifications, and coordinating with Hardware and Test groups. 
Managed software revision control system (CVS), revision control server, defect tracking system (DevTrack), performed backups of databases, and software build process. 
Managed software engineering group from 8/2002 to 1/2003, worked with Hardware, Test, and Marketing groups. Software Engineer Broadband Gateways September 2000  –  June 2001  (10 months) Lead developer for 2.4Ghz handset LCD MMI and modified Call Processing software as part of the port from 900Mhz to 2.4Ghz for a PowerPC 860SAR based VoATM gateway system. 
Developed scripts, implemented new configuration management procedures and managed CVS software revision control system on Linux for over 20 developers across four development groups. Summary Too amateur to be a geek, too geek to be an amateur. I'm a middleman between development and management, responsible for software quality and account management.  
 
I strongly believe that there’s only one thing needed to change the world for better: EDUCATION.  
 
Professional background: I tried different roles through my career. At 14 I started from cleaning the factory floor around people programming PLC controllers. The next year I came back as a PLC programming assistant. I Studied in Poland and acquired BS degree in Computer Science. During studies I was a freelancer doing web design and development. I was a test Engineer for Symantec products and been to Iran as a telco backbone system analyst and developer as well as spent a while at a call center’s channel development team. While working for Intel as an Education Ecosystem Manager for CEE I realized the importance of bringing technology to schools and education technology became the most important field I'm interested in. At Intellisense, I'm devoted to bringing highest quality education software to thousands of schools in the world.  
 
Personal: In private life, I enjoy all kinds of woodworking, especially giving new life to pieces found on the street or garage sales. I'm a djembe (what the heck is that? Google is your friend) player and hope to create a band with my sons in the future. Summary Too amateur to be a geek, too geek to be an amateur. I'm a middleman between development and management, responsible for software quality and account management.

The next year I came back as a PLC programming assistant. I Studied in Poland and acquired BS degree in Computer Science. During studies I was a freelancer doing web design and development. I was a test Engineer for Symantec products and been to Iran as a telco backbone system analyst and developer as well as spent a while at a call center’s channel development team. While working for Intel as an Education Ecosystem Manager for CEE I realized the importance of bringing technology to schools and education technology became the most important field I'm interested in. At Intellisense, I'm devoted to bringing highest quality education software to thousands of schools in the world.  
 
Personal: In private life, I enjoy all kinds of woodworking, especially giving new life to pieces found on the street or garage sales. I'm a djembe (what the heck is that? Google is your friend) player and hope to create a band with my sons in the future. Too amateur to be a geek, too geek to be an amateur. I'm a middleman between development and management, responsible for software quality and account management.  
 
I strongly believe that there’s only one thing needed to change the world for better: EDUCATION.
